intro: Bredemeyera microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved bredeleya, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Bredemeyera microphylla is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in xeriscaping.
